Q-Learning.name: Q-Learning
Q-Learning.description: A simple tabular reinforcement learning algorithm that learns the value of actions in states.

sections.whatIsIt: Q-Learning learns a Q-function Q(s,a) that estimates the expected cumulative reward of taking action 'a' in state 's' and following the optimal policy thereafter.
howItWorks: Take action a, observe reward r and next state s'
Q(s,a) ← Q(s,a) + α[r + γ·max Q(s',a') - Q(s,a)]

keyConcepts.qValue: Expected cumulative reward for taking action 'a' in state 's'
keyConcepts.exploration: Trying random actions to discover new strategies
keyConcepts.exploitation: Using current knowledge to maximize reward
keyConcepts.epsilonGreedy: A policy that chooses a random action with probability ε and the best-known action with probability 1-ε

learningRate.description: How much to update Q-values. Higher = faster learning but less stable.

discountFactor.description: Importance of future rewards. Higher = more long-term planning.

explorationRate.description: Probability of random exploration. Higher = more exploration.

links.text: Article by Maxime Labonne: Q-Learning on the FrozenLake environment
